intro: Psychotria gibbsiae var. velutina, commonly known as the velvety psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, and it is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
